intro: Lactucopsis brevirostris, commonly known as the short-nosed lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, rosette-forming leaves and a short, stout stem. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, sandy soils. Lactucopsis brevirostris is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
